Celebrations mark Juneteenth in BostonJuneteenth celebrations kicked off Friday afternoon in Boston, with participants issuing passionate calls for racial justice amid a deadly pandemic that’s disproportionately hurt communities of color, as well as protests against recent police killings of Black people in cities including Minneapolis, Atlanta, and Louisville.
Live updates from vigils and rallies marking Juneteenth
Photos: Boston area celebrates and reflects on Juneteenth

Amid nationwide protests for racial justice, Juneteenth gets new renownProtesters marched over the Brooklyn Bridge, chanted “We want justice now!” near St. Louis' Gateway Arch, prayed in Atlanta, and paused for a moment of silence at the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial in Washington, as Americans marked Juneteenth Friday with new urgency amid protests to demand racial justice.

Kendi, director of the new BU Center for Antiracist Research, and Globe Editorial Page Editor Bina Venkataraman discussed what an antiracist movement in the US might look like, and how we can hasten its progress.

Juneteenth takes on new meaning amid nationwide protests for racial justiceProtesters marched over the Brooklyn Bridge, chanted “We want justice now!” near St. Louis’ Gateway Arch, prayed in Atlanta, and paused for a moment of silence at the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial in Washington, as Americans marked Juneteenth with new urgency Friday amid a nationwide push for racial justice.
